name: --nys-color-theme
description: Primary brand color. Used for primary actions and interactive elements like buttons, checkboxes, and agency-specific headers and footers. Overridden by agency-specific themes.

name: --nys-color-theme-strong
description: Stronger shade of theme color, used for hover state on interactive elements. Overridden by agency-specific themes.

name: --nys-color-theme-stronger
description: Strongest shade of theme color, used for pressed state on interactive elements. Overridden by agency-specific themes.

name: --nys-color-theme-mid
description: Mid-range shade of theme color. Use sparingly, since text contrast against this color is problematic. Overridden by agency-specific themes.

name: --nys-color-theme-weak
description: Slightly lighter shade of theme color. Overridden by agency-specific themes.

name: --nys-color-theme-weaker
description: Lighter shade of theme color, used to subtly convey brand in places with a lot of text, like the global agency footer. Overridden by agency-specific themes.

name: --nys-color-theme-faint
description: Faint shade of the theme color. Good for subtle accents or backgrounds. Overridden by agency-specific themes.

name: --nys-color-accent
description: Bold accent color for highlighting or emphasis. Use sparingly, especially in application contexts where it can be confused with warning or error colors.

name: --nys-color-info
description: Informational color for neutral messages.

name: --nys-color-info-weak
description: Used as a background for informational contexts with a lot of text, like alerts.

name: --nys-color-success
description: Used to communicate successful actions or states.

name: --nys-color-success-weak
description: Used as a background for success contexts with a lot of text, like alerts.

name: --nys-color-warning
description: Used as a warning color for non-critical alerts.

name: --nys-color-warning-weak
description: Used as a background for warning contexts with a lot of text, like alerts.

name: --nys-color-danger
description: Used to indicate destructive actions or failures.

name: --nys-color-danger-weak
description: Used as a background in destructive or error contexts with a lot of text, like alerts.

name: --nys-color-emergency
description: Emergency color for critical alerts or actions. Use sparingly.

name: --nys-color-ink
description: Default text color. Provides good legibility.

name: --nys-color-ink-reverse
description: Reverse text color for dark backgrounds.

name: --nys-color-link
description: Standard color for text links.

name: --nys-color-link-strong
description: Used for hover and active states on text links.

name: --nys-color-link-strongest
description: Used for pressed states on text links.

name: --nys-color-focus
description: Used to color focus rings on interactive elements.

name: --nys-font-family-sans
description: Primary brand font, used for content, headers, and UI text. → Proxima Nova, -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, Segoe UI, Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif, Apple Color Emoji, Segoe UI Emoji, Segoe UI Symbol

name: --nys-font-family-agency
description: Brand font used only for agency, program, and initiative titles. → D Sari, Arial, sans-serif

name: --nys-font-family-alt
description: Alternate brand font, used sparingly for accent in public-facing sites. → Oswald, Arial, sans-serif

name: --nys-font-size-2xs
description: Extra-extra-small font size. Typically used for fine print or disclaimers. → 10px

name: --nys-font-size-xs
description: Extra-small font size. Used for less prominent labels or captions. → 12px

name: --nys-font-size-sm
description: Small font size. Commonly used for secondary text or labels. → 14px

name: --nys-font-size-md
description: Medium font size. Default body text size. → 16px

name: --nys-font-size-lg
description: Large font size. Used for subheadings or larger labels. → 18px

name: --nys-font-size-xl
description: Extra-large font size. Used for headings or standout elements. → 20px

name: --nys-font-size-2xl
description: Double extra-large font size. Commonly used for secondary headings. → 22px

name: --nys-font-size-3xl
description: Triple extra-large font size. Used for primary headings or key text. → 24px

name: --nys-font-size-4xl
description: Quadruple extra-large font size. Typically used for prominent headlines. → 28px

name: --nys-font-size-5xl
description: Quintuple extra-large font size. Reserved for key marketing or hero sections. → 32px

name: --nys-font-size-6xl
description: Six times extra-large font size. Used for impactful hero text. → 36px

name: --nys-font-size-7xl
description: Seven times extra-large font size. Highly prominent text. → 40px

name: --nys-font-size-8xl
description: Eight times extra-large font size. Typically for titles or splash content. → 44px

name: --nys-font-size-9xl
description: Nine times extra-large font size. Maximum size for hero content. → 50px

name: --nys-space-1px
description: Spacing tokens standardize margins, padding, and gaps in layouts. This is ultra-thin for fine detail, like borders or dividers.

name: --nys-space-2px
description: Very small spacing for micro-adjustments or compact layouts.

name: --nys-space-50
description: Extra-small spacing, typically used for tight content spacing.

name: --nys-space-100
description: Small spacing, often used for compact layouts or minimal margins.

name: --nys-space-150
description: Small-medium spacing for general UI elements.

name: --nys-space-200
description: Medium spacing, commonly used for standard element separation.

name: --nys-space-250
description: Medium-large spacing for container padding or visual balance.

name: --nys-space-300
description: Standard spacing for layouts with moderate separation.

name: --nys-space-400
description: Large spacing for separating sections or creating visual breaks.

name: --nys-space-500
description: Extra-large spacing for major sections or wide gaps.

name: --nys-space-600
description: Very large spacing, often used for section padding or layouts.

name: --nys-space-700
description: Generous spacing for wide content separation.

name: --nys-space-800
description: Maximum spacing for highly open designs or major layouts.

name: --nys-space-1200
description: Largest spacing token for creating significant visual separation.

name: --nys-size-1px
description: Size tokens standardize the width and height of elements, like icons, typography, and UI components.

name: --nys-size-2px
description: Slightly thicker size for minimal elements, such as borders.

name: --nys-size-50
description: Extra-small size for compact UI elements or icons.

name: --nys-size-100
description: Small size for UI elements or containers.

name: --nys-size-150
description: Small-medium size for buttons or small containers.

name: --nys-size-200
description: Medium size, often used for inputs or cards.

name: --nys-size-250
description: Medium-large size for slightly larger UI elements.

name: --nys-size-300
description: Standard size for larger UI controls or containers.

name: --nys-size-400
description: Large size for buttons, modals, or prominent elements.

name: --nys-size-500
description: Very large size for main containers or sections.

name: --nys-size-600
description: Extra-large size for significant UI containers or elements.

name: --nys-size-700
description: Massive size for prominent layout features.

name: --nys-size-800
description: Largest size for visual anchors or major elements.

name: --nys-size-1200
description: Maximum size for expansive layouts or hero elements.

name: --nys-radius-xs
description: Extra-small radius for subtle rounding.

name: --nys-radius-sm
description: Small radius for slightly rounded elements.

name: --nys-radius-md
description: Medium radius input elements like text fields, checkboxes, and select dropdowns.

name: --nys-radius-lg
description: Larger radius for a more pronounced rounding.

name: --nys-radius-xl
description: Extra-large radius for buttons, to quickly indicate interactivity.

name: --nys-radius-round
description: Fully rounded elements. Used for avatars and icons.
